00024 static long long int MAX_MAP_SIZE = (long long int) 0x80000000;

00030 static const char *http_header =
00031 // REQUEST LINE
00032                 HTTP_METHOD_HEAD        // method
00033                 " %s "                  // request-uri
00034                 HTTP_VERSION            // http version
00035                 CRLF                    // CRLF
00036                 // REQUEST HEADER
00037                 HTTP_RQ_HOST
00038                 " %s "                  // hostname
00039                 CRLF CRLF;
00040 
00041 static const char *http_chunk =
00042 // REQUEST LINE
00043                 HTTP_METHOD_GET         // method
00044                 " %s "                  // request-uri
00045                 HTTP_VERSION            // http version
00046                 CRLF                    // CRLF
00047                 // REQUEST HEADER
00048                 HTTP_RQ_HOST
00049                 " %s "                  // hostname
00050                 CRLF
00051                 // RANGE RETRIEVAL REQUEST
00052                 HTTP_RQ_RANGE_BYTES
00053                 "%s"                    // first byte pos
00054                 "-"
00055                 "%s"                    // last byte pos
00056                 CRLF CRLF;

00063 int
00064 http_header_req(http_sockfd sockfd, lnk *link)
00065 {
00066         char * hd_rq_str;
00067         size_t hd_len = _sprintf(2, &hd_rq_str, http_header, link->rquri,
00068                         link->hostname);
00069         if (write(sockfd, (const void *) hd_rq_str, hd_len) == -1) {
00070                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00071                 "header file couldn't be sent in link:%s", link->hostname);
00072                 return (-1);
00073         }
00074         free(hd_rq_str);
00075 
00076         return (0);
00077 }
00078 
00084 int
00085 http_header_res(http_sockfd sockfd, lnk_http_header *linkh)
00086 {
00087         headerbufs *hbufs = malloc(sizeof (headerbufs));
00088         if (http_header_read(sockfd, hbufs) == -1)
00089                 return (-1);
00090         if (link_header_parse(hbufs->hdata, linkh) != HTTP_STATUSCODE_OK)
00091                 return (-1);
00092 
00093         free(hbufs->hdata);
00094         free(hbufs->remain);
00095         free(hbufs);
00096 
00097         return (0);
00098 }
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Function converts char* status code into http_statcode_grp enum.
00102  * \return      if code is NULL or unknown returns UNKNOWN
00103  *              else returns value from http_statcode_grp enum.
00104  */
00105 http_statcode_grp
00106 http_str2statuscode_grp(char *code)
00107 {
00108         char nr;
00109         if (code == NULL)
00110                 return (UNKNOWN);
00111         nr = code[0];
00112         if (nr == '1')
00113                 return (INFORM);
00114         if (nr == '2')
00115                 return (SUCCESS);
00116         if (nr == '3')
00117                 return (REDIRECT);
00118         if (nr == '4')
00119                 return (CLIENT_ERR);
00120         if (nr == '5')
00121                 return (SERVER_ERR);
00122         return (UNKNOWN);
00123 }

00129 http_sockfd
00130 http_socket(void)
00131 {
00132 #ifdef HTTP_IPV6_SOCKS
00133         return (socket(AF_INET6, SOCK_STREAM, 0));
00134 #else
00135         return (socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0));
00136 #endif
00137 }

00143 int
00144 http_connect(http_sockfd *sockfd, const lnk *link)
00145 {
00146         *sockfd = http_socket();
00147 
00148         struct hostent *hp;
00149         const char *hstr_err;
00150 
00151         if ((hp = gethostbyname(link->hostname)) == NULL) {
00152                 hstr_err = hstrerror(h_errno);
00153                 fprintf(stdlog,
00154                 log_ERROR "Couldn't resolve host name in link: %s message:%s\n",
00155                 link->hostname, hstr_err);
00156                 return (-1);
00157         }
00158 
00159 #ifdef HTTP_IPV6_SOCKS
00160         struct sockaddr_in6 sin;
00161         sin.sin6_family = AF_INET6;
00162         sin.sin6_port = htons(HTTP_PORT);
00163         sin.sin6_addr = *((struct in6_addr *)hp->h_addr_list[0]);
00164 #else
00165         struct sockaddr_in sin;
00166         sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
00167         sin.sin_port = htons(HTTP_PORT);
00168         sin.sin_addr = *((struct in_addr *) hp->h_addr_list[0]);
00169 #endif
00170         if (connect(*sockfd, (struct sockaddr *) &sin,
00171                                         sizeof (sin)) == -1) {
00172                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "Could't connect to hostname: %s\n",
00173                                 link->hostname);
00174                 return (-1);
00175         }
00176 
00177         return (0);
00178 }

00188 int
00189 http_link_header(lnk *link, lnk_http_header **linkhp)
00190 {
00191         http_sockfd sockfd;
00192         if (http_connect(&sockfd, link) == -1)
00193                 return (-1);
00194         *linkhp = malloc(sizeof (lnk_http_header));
00195 
00196         if ((http_header_req(sockfd, link)) == -1)
00197                 return (-1);
00198         if ((http_header_res(sockfd, *linkhp)) == -1)
00199                 return (-1);
00200 
00201         return (http_close(sockfd));
00202 }

00208 int
00209 http_chunk_req(http_sockfd sockfd, chunk_bounds* bounds)
00210 {
00211         char *ch_rq_str;
00212         char *sstartpos;
00213         char *sendpos;
00214 
00215         sstartpos = malloc(RANGE_BYTES_MAX_LEN);
00216         sendpos = malloc(RANGE_BYTES_MAX_LEN);
00217 
00218         snprintf(sstartpos, RANGE_BYTES_MAX_LEN, "%li", bounds->startpos);
00219         snprintf(sendpos, RANGE_BYTES_MAX_LEN, "%li", bounds->endpos);
00220 
00221         size_t hd_len = _sprintf(4, &ch_rq_str, http_chunk, bounds->lnk->rquri,
00222                         bounds->lnk->hostname, sstartpos, sendpos);
00223         if (write(sockfd, (const void *) ch_rq_str, hd_len) == -1) {
00224                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00225                                 "chunk request couldn't be sent in link:%s",
00226                                 bounds->lnk->hostname);
00227                 return (-1);
00228         }
00229         return (0);
00230 }

00239 statcode
00240 link_header_parse(char *buff, lnk_http_header* linkh)
00241 {
00242         char *tok, *hd, *hd_protocol, *hd_statuscode; //  *hd_reason_phase;
00243         char *occur;
00244         char *slholder, *hdholder;
00245 
00246         size_t head_len_conl = strlen(HTTP_HEAD_CONTLEN);
00247         size_t head_len_cont = strlen(HTTP_HEAD_CONTTYPE);
00248 
00249         linkh->clen = 0;
00250         linkh->ctype = HTTP_CONTTYPE_DEF;
00251         linkh->statcodegrp = UNKNOWN;
00252 
00253         tok = _strtok(&hdholder, buff, CRLF);
00254 
00255         hd = strdup(tok);
00256         hd_protocol = _strtok(&slholder, hd, WS);
00257         hd_statuscode = _strtok(&slholder, NULL, WS);
00258         // d_reason_phase = strdup(slholder);// strtok(&slholder, NULL, WS);
00259 
00260         if (hd_statuscode == NULL) {
00261                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "Couldn't read link response"
00262                                 " status line (in parsing)");
00263                 return (-1);
00264         }
00265 
00266         linkh->statcodegrp = http_str2statuscode_grp(hd_statuscode);
00267 
00268         while ((tok = _strtok(&hdholder, NULL, CRLF)) != NULL) {
00269                 if ((occur = strstr(tok, HTTP_HEAD_CONTLEN)) != NULL) {
00270                         linkh->clen = STRTOOFF_T(occur+head_len_conl, NULL, 10);
00271                         if (errno == ERANGE) {
00272                                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00273                                                 "Unrecognized content "
00274                                                 "length (value out of range)");
00275                                 return (-1);
00276                         }
00277                         continue;
00278                 }
00279                 if ((occur = strstr(tok, HTTP_HEAD_CONTTYPE)) != NULL) {
00280                         linkh->ctype = _trim(strdup(occur+head_len_cont));
00281                 }
00282         }
00283 
00284         if ((linkh->clen == 0) || (linkh->ctype == '\0')) {
00285                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "Response header doesn't"
00286                                 " contain length or content type");
00287                 return (-1);
00288         }
00289 
00290         return (atoi(hd_statuscode));
00291         //  return (0);
00292 }
00293 
00306 int
00307 http_header_read(http_sockfd sockfd, headerbufs *hbufs)
00308 {
00309 //      hbufs->
00310         size_t size = 1;
00311         size_t osize;
00312         size_t curr_buf_size = HTTP_BUFF_SIZE;
00313         char *rpos = '\0';
00314         char *buff = malloc(curr_buf_size);
00315 
00316         char http_buf[HTTP_BUFF_SIZE];
00317         ssize_t sz;
00318 
00319         while ((sz = read(sockfd, http_buf, HTTP_BUFF_SIZE)) > 0) {
00320                 osize = size;
00321                 size += sz;
00322                 while (size > curr_buf_size) {
00323                         curr_buf_size *= 2;
00324                         if ((buff = realloc(buff, curr_buf_size)) == NULL) {
00325                                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "http buffer "
00326                                                 "couldn't be reallocated");
00327                                 return (-1);
00328                         }
00329                 }
00330                 memcpy(buff + osize - 1, http_buf, sz);
00331                 buff[size - 1] = '\0';
00332                 if ((rpos = strstr(buff, CRLF CRLF)) != NULL)
00333                 break;
00334         }
00335 
00336         if (rpos == NULL) {
00337                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "Header couldn't be read!");
00338                 return (-1);
00339         }
00340 
00341         hbufs->rlen = buff + size - rpos - 4 - 1;
00342         // trlen(rpos) - 4; // + 1 - 4) +1 (NULL) - 4 CRLF CRLF
00343 
00344         if (hbufs->rlen > 0) {
00345                 hbufs->remain = malloc(hbufs->rlen);
00346                 memcpy(hbufs->remain, rpos + 4, hbufs->rlen); // 4 - CR LF CR LF
00347         } else {
00348                 hbufs->remain = NULL;
00349         }
00350 
00351         hbufs->hsize = rpos - buff + 1; // +1 (NULL)
00352         hbufs->hdata = realloc(buff, hbufs->hsize);
00353         hbufs->hdata[hbufs->hsize-1] = '\0';
00354 
00355         return (0);
00356 }

00364 int
00365 http_chunk_res(http_sockfd sockfd, char *memory, size_t memlen,
00366                 chunk_bounds* bounds) // ODO bounds pomocna
00367 {
00368         headerbufs *hbufs = malloc(sizeof (headerbufs));
00369         lnk_http_header* linkh = malloc(sizeof (lnk_http_header));
00370         statcode scode;
00371         size_t toread;
00372         size_t readed;
00373         file_fd chfd;
00374         long long int readsz = 0;
00375         char *wbuffer;
00376         int wbuffersize = 10000;
00377 
00378         if (http_header_read(sockfd, hbufs) == -1)
00379                 return (-1);
00380         if ((scode = link_header_parse(hbufs->hdata, linkh))
00381                         != HTTP_STATUSCODE_PARTIAL) {
00382                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00383                                 "Response message not PARTIAL CONTENT:"
00384                                 " status code:%i", scode);
00385                 return (-1);
00386         }
00387 
00388         if (linkh->clen != memlen) {
00389                 fprintf(stdlog,
00390                                 log_ERROR "Range in response douesn't"
00391                                 " despond to range in request\n");
00392                 return (-1);
00393         }
00394 
00395         toread = memlen - hbufs->rlen;
00396         readsz = hbufs->rlen;
00397 
00398         // memory couldn't be mapped, write directly into file
00399         if (memory == NULL) {
00400                 if ((chfd = dup(bounds->fd)) == -1) {
00401                         fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00402                                         "Cannot duplicate fd for chunk %s,"
00403                                         "Aborting", bounds->lnk->rquri);
00404                         return (-1);
00405                 }
00406 
00407                 if (lseek(chfd, ((long long int)bounds->mpidx) * MAX_MAP_SIZE +
00408                                 bounds->startpos, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
00409                         fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00410                                         "Cannot lseek file for chunk %s,"
00411                                         "Aborting", bounds->lnk->rquri);
00412                         return (-1);
00413                 }
00414                 // TODO
00415                 if (write(chfd, hbufs->remain, hbufs->rlen) != hbufs->rlen) {
00416                         fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00417                                         "Cannot write whole buffer into file"
00418                                         " for chunk %s, Aborting",
00419                                         bounds->lnk->rquri);
00420                         return (-1);
00421                 }
00422 
00423                 wbuffer = malloc(wbuffersize);
00424 
00425                 if (wbuffersize > toread) {
00426                         wbuffersize = toread;
00427                 }
00428 
00429                 while ((toread > 0) && ((readed =
00430                                 read(sockfd, wbuffer, wbuffersize)) > 0)) {
00431                         readsz += readed;
00432                         memory += readed;
00433                         toread -= readed;
00434 
00435                         write(chfd, wbuffer, wbuffersize);
00436 
00437                         if (wbuffersize > toread) {
00438                                 wbuffersize = toread;
00439                         }
00440                 }
00441 
00442                 free(hbufs->hdata);
00443                 free(hbufs->remain);
00444                 free(hbufs);
00445 
00446                 close(chfd);
00447                 free(wbuffer);
00448                 return (0);
00449         }
00450 
00451         // copy data into mapped memory
00452         memcpy(memory, hbufs->remain, hbufs->rlen);
00453 
00454         memory += hbufs->rlen;
00455         while ((toread > 0) && ((readed = read(sockfd, memory, toread)) > 0)) {
00456                 readsz += readed;
00457                 memory += readed;
00458                 toread -= readed;
00459         }
00460 
00461         if (toread > 0) {
00462                 perror("read");
00463                 fprintf(stdlog,
00464                                 log_ERROR
00465                                 "Cannot write whole buffer into mapped memory "
00466                                 "for chunk %s,"
00467                                 "Aborting", bounds->lnk->rquri);
00468                 return (-1);
00469         }
00470 
00471         free(hbufs->hdata);
00472         free(hbufs->remain);
00473         free(hbufs);
00474 
00475         return (0);
00476 }

00486 int
00487 http_link_write_chunk(chunk_bounds* bounds)
00488 {
00489         http_sockfd sockfd;
00490         if (http_connect(&sockfd, bounds->lnk) == -1)
00491                 return (-1);
00492         if (http_chunk_req(sockfd, bounds) == -1)
00493                 return (-1);
00494         if ((http_chunk_res(sockfd, bounds->memory,
00495                         bounds->memlen, bounds)) == -1)
00496                 return (-1);
00497 
00498         return (http_close(sockfd));
00499 }
00500 
00505 int
00506 http_close(http_sockfd sockfd)
00507 {
00508         char *strerr;
00509         if (close(sockfd) != 0) {
00510                 strerr = strerror(errno);
00511                 fprintf(stdlog, strerr);
00512                 free(strerr);
00513                 return (-1);
00514         }
00515         return (0);
00516 }
